intro: Hieracium pycnodon, commonly known as the denseleaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are densely hairy and often clustered at the base, giving it a compact appearance. Hieracium pycnodon produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
